item.description:
We chatted with Preservation Worcester to schedule this walking tour of these locations:

We will be starting at Preservation Worcester and then walk to...

Worcester Common and City Hall
Stand where the Declaration of Independence was read in 1776 for the first time in New England.   See the glorious interior of our grand 1898 City Hall.  Learn how our Common has served as public open space and the site of municipal government from the 18th century to today.    See the 18th century gravestones in the old Common burial ground and find out about the various monuments on the grounds.

Main Street:  From Mechanics Hall to City Hall
Walk along Main Street in the heart of downtown Worcester and learn about the buildings, old and new, that make up the streetscape. 

Then going along to Crown Hill off of Pleasant Street.

 

Please plan to bring your camera's and gear. Water, snack, and wear comfy walking shoes. This is about 1.5-2 hours worth of walking, learning and clicking!

 

See you then!

 

Cheers,

Donna
item.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting in the Parking lot across from Preservation Worcester. Meet us there!
item.why: Explore the Architecture of the City of Worcester & have some new images for the upcoming WPC Gallery Show this is a chance to get out with a group and do it! Or if you just want to have some fun on a Worcester Click and shoot- join us!

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Architecture of Worcester Click and Shoot- NOTE MEETING LOCATION CHANGE!!
